result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan R Shelto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied.  Fine paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan R Shelto

records.addlTxt:
11:27 AM Defendant Ryan R Shelto in court.  Attorney Ronald Sonderhouse for Peter M Wolff in court for Ryan R Shelto.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Counts 1 and 2 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Count 3 is dismissed and read in.


The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
FINE: $ 330.50
	
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid immediately after court today.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.


Count 2:
FINE: $ 330.50
	
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid immediately after court today.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:43 AM Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Ryan R Shelto did not appear.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.
Defense requests plea and sentencing date in about 60 days to allow time for defendant to arrange for travel from Maryland.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
